biography.summary: Cynthia M. Lummis is an American attorney and Republican politician serving as the U.S. Senator from Wyoming since 2021. Previously she served as the U.S. Representative for Wyoming's at-large congressional district from 2009 to 2017.
biography.early_life: Born September 10, 1954, in Cheyenne, Wyoming. She earned degrees from the University of Wyoming.
biography.education: Bachelor's degree in political science and a Juris Doctor from the University of Wyoming.
biography.career: Attorney, businesswoman, and Republican politician who served in the U.S. House of Representatives (2009-2017) before being elected to the Senate.

contact.office_address: 127A Russell Senate Office Building, Washington, DC 20510

policy_positions.stance: Supports expanded domestic energy production and continued use of fossil fuels while pursuing environmental safeguards.
Advocates for deregulation and pro-growth policies in the financial sector.

bills_sponsored.title: Energy Independence and Jobs Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Promotes U.S. energy independence through expanded domestic energy production and infrastructure investment.

bills_sponsored.title: Wyoming Economic Growth and Development Act
bills_sponsored.summary: Aims to stimulate economic growth and development in Wyoming through investment in infrastructure and business incentives.

timeline.event: Elected to U.S. House of Representatives representing Wyoming's at-large district (2009-2017).
Elected to the U.S. Senate from Wyoming (class 2).
